div.p: for every day in the year-Cash Account
for every month in the year.
1860. Jan. Feb. Mar. April May June 1860. July. Aug. Sept. Oct. Nov. Dec.
Sun. Mon. Tues. Wed. Thurs. Frid. Sat. Sun. Mon. Tues. Wed. Thurs. Frid. Sat. Sun.
Showing the number of days from any day in one month, to the same day in any
Look for April at the left hand, and September at the top; in the angle is 153
Slave Trade abolished, U. S. 7 25 4 43 morn
5 T Treaty bet. Eng. and U. S. ., 7 25 4 47 4 27
8 A Battle of New Orleans, 1815. 7 24 4 50 rises.
DD NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. sets.
6 M Eclipse of Moon visible. 7 5 5 23 rises.
8 W Mary Queen of Scots killed, 7 3 5 26 7 47
12 A Lady J. Grey beheaded, 1554. 6 58 5 31 morn
19 A Florida ceded to U. S., 1821. 6 49 5 40 5 42
D D NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. sets.
D D NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. sets.
21 S Battle of San Jacinto, 1836. 5 13 6 46 sets.
D D NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. sets.
D D NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. sets.

13 F Battle of the Pequods, 1637. 4 39 7 30 morn
D D NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. rises.
D D NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. rises.
10 M Battle of Lake Erie, 1813. 5 35 6 18 morn
D D NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. rises.
22 M Battle of Red Bank, 1777. 6 20 5 10 morn
29 M Sir W. Raleigh executed, 1618 6 27 5 1 rises.
D D NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. rises.
28 W Great Fog in London, 1840. 7 2 4 35 rises.
DM DW NOTABLE DAYS. rises sets. rises.
16 A Great Fire in N. Y., 1835. 7 18 4 33 10 6
Report to Gen Hamilton Head Martens to high mas ten with 50 way you by order of carmal van gen lumpys 9mm
Went to germantown Gao waggons 15 mil from Memphis
came back to germantown loaded with amunition
Went to Headquarters 3 miles from Memphis
loaded with provision & came to camp
Went to Memphis for Hay & grn
went out to germantown for Mail
went to Mem for forage & Clothing.
Went Memphis for clothing Ambulance & Harness
rained all day Snowed all Night.
the deepest Snow that has fell here for 18 yr
went the City for rations forage
Mc Arther Divis. were going on mtn Roats
Went to the City got 33 bales of Hay
Went to town for forage 20 teams
at night went to the regiment
went to Memphis with 25 teams for forage
Moved Head Quarters one mile from Memphis
Went to town for Hay Coal & Q M Stores
Went to town for Tn Cloudy bamvas
turned the teams over to Hurlbut
Turned over to the Post 48 animals
rained all day went to town & turned over 2 miners & 20 Harness
Went to town for Hay got 74 bales
went to town with 18 teams but got no load
Moved in to Memphis & went board the Steamer Sirpemon
turned over to the post 88 Mules 16 horses load ed on the teams
Left Memphis at 6 o clock for lake Providence
Landed 3 miles north of, Louisania line in Arkansas near Grand lake at Sun down.
Staid on Shore keanas turning peach trees in bloom
arrived at Hellena at Sun down Cold & foggy.
Rained Hard all day Laid on Grone 4 miles below Hellena Got a letter from Ann.
Went up to hellena the Superior went off & I Staid on the primadona
Laid on Shore drew raitons for 30 days
Loaded the teams on the AreEli Steam Worked All Night
started down the Yazoo pass at 8 o ' cl the Stream 70 feet wide at noon
stops- to take down the pipes two Mile from Moonlost but did not went 10 miles
traveled about 8 miles the stream very difficult to navigate
tied up for the night near a plantation passed
was coming down the Sun frowerpleasant
arrived in cold water at three o clock
very warm took the stack as hom
waited for the fleet to come up
Started down the cold water very pleasant & warm
on the boat going down the river
on the way down the Cold water got to the Tallahatchee at 6 o ' clock
passed the 22-32-33-36 Iowa regmts & 4 gun Boats going to Hellena
Arrived within 4 miles of the R.Bat & tied up
Was sick did not do any thing
rained all day ordely Tipton was Shot
onloaded the waggons & Hawled wood for the Boats
gen 2 two Regs Same Battery & Cavelry gone out reconorttring
go a letter from Harrison & Ella
got a letter from wife & answered it
very Cold heavy frost at night
at night loaded the teams on the Duke Argyle
Started up the river for Hellena Abandoned the yazoo Expadition
The Cheese Man fired into her Cap Killed
going up the Tallahatchie. Tthe Tecumsa fired into Tis with reluctance that Gen Quimby returnes up the pass but he has to abay orders of Superiors
arrived at the mouth of Cold Water
tied up at the mouth of Sun flower
arrived at Hellena at moon of safe -
Laid in Camp 4 miles below Hellena
Went to Hellena to turn over mules
The 1st & 3d Brig left here for lake providence
got a letter from wife Been unwell for Sometime with the Cronic diareah
Brig left Camp in Hellena for
Arrived at Millikens Bend in the night
went to the reg Haspatal sick with the Billious feever
Co Mathies got his papers as Brig gen
Came to this con-valescent hospital Crystol Palace
there is 700 sick on board -9-died - to day
Enough food rather hard for a Sick man
one of the large gunboats went down the river.
gun Boats all went up the Yazoo
very warm the water is falling fast
Still in Hos. do not gain very much
nothing of interest Still in the Haspatal
very warm had Preaching on the Bank at night
A H Pierce Enlisted under D E Huse in 6th Iowa 5 11, I.C.C.
Left home for davenport at 8, PM
drew my uniform and made Application for a Pass
recieved a letter from Sister Ann
Made 2 tables & Cubboard for Capt Suttles
recieved a letter from father & one from my wife
had grand inspection brass band plaied
Tom Hine troted a mile in 2.81
Bashaw was the next best Horse
Visited the forts in Rock Iland
Brass Band plaid at Camp McClellan
the cavelry left here for St. Louis
Capt Spittler refused to give a pass from events go to my Sistfamily
Went to town & herd C C Nourse discuss the Issue of the present afairs in our coun-try
Very Pleasant passed Burlington in the night
got to Keo Kuk at dark
at 8 o'clock about 3 miles be low we passed Carondelet where they were making Several Iron clad Boats.
7 o'clock arrived at Cape Jerid some 40 miles above Cairo wery pleasant
arrived at Cairo at 2 o ' c
left Cairo at 4 o ' clock P.M.
for 10 miles out, heavy timber very level & wet
Went to Camp found Charles well went out over the battle ground & the grave yard
Very pleasant- heavy frost ice 1/4 inch
left Corinth for grand junction at 2 o ' clock. We camped 10 miles north of corinth in a corn field at gosolack
very cold at night and frost
passed through purdy at 2 o ' clock & Bethel at 5 o ' clock
Campt 5 miles west of Bethel Camp 5 miles west of Bethel froze
I hhat night started at Gol passed through some good country. there is Pine Chesnut & Oak timber
Campt at a Steam mill 9 miles from Bolivar Pleasant
Pased through Bolivar about noon. This is a prety place. plenty of niy
Campt 5 miles west of Bolivar. Pleasant but very dusty
passed Some good plantations but the Boys made the things along the road suffer. Cloudy
Very pleasant arrived at camp on Davis Creek Miss. found George fat and Saucy as ever. this is a pleasant place.
Very warm and pleasant in Camp near Davis Creek
A waiting to have the R.R. bridges re bilt that the Rebels burnt
wrote a letter to Wille. we ar campt near a nice church
went on grand review Saw U S
rained all the after noon Campt 7 miles west of Lagrange.
Cloudy. Stopt at moscow for diner
Campt at Moscow 10 miles from Laagrange
very pleasant our regiment gone forageing
recvd a letter from wife - father & Sister
66 mules and 11 men of our division taken prisoners
recieved a letter from Harrison & James
Started on a march to Holly Springs
Advanced 3 miles & Halted Staid there till Sunset
We traveled till one o ' clock
laid down in the road to Sleep - Came in to camp near a pond
went to Davis Creek Station after provisions
campt 4 miles south of Holly Springs
Came in to Head quarters near
campt at a creek 7 miles north of oxford
went out 8 miles & got 68 bales of cotton
got a letter from Ann- Ann-
went out 5 miles & got 100 bales cotton all marked C.S.A.
Came to Hills-dale & back to Oxford
went out 5 miles after corn to grind
laid at oxford waiting for the cars
went after cotton- 8 miles H & P2ice nice farm
March back to Oxford Expected an attack
laid in Camp was appointed Waggon Master
returned & campt north of the Talla Hatchee
to go to Holly Sp with 60wagons
went to H.S. & loaded with Sick & went 15 miles on toward Memphis & overtook the train
Went to a creek 7 miles from Memphis
pased ft. Madison is a very fine city but little buisness at present. The penitentiary buildings are 2 1/2 Stories high Surrounded by a Stone Wall 18 feet high The sentinals were walking on the top-
This boat The Canada is 175 feet long & 40 ft wide it toes 3 barges 100 feet long all loaded with grain.
Manwas Ill. part of the old, Morman temple is Still Standing there
Mount Rose Iowa is a sad town we Stoped there.
to take off Some of the load So that we could go over the rappids there is 17000 Sacks of Wheat, Barley & oats. The cars run through this place to Burlington from KeoKuk
Arrived at Keokuk at 6 o ' c

this is the nicest city that I have seen in Iowa it contains 15,000 inhabitance I went ashore with Mr. Mays to See his brother & had a good Supper, then is 2000 Sick & wounded Soldiers there. We left in the night and arrived at Quincy, Ill. at 7o ' c
this is a fine city contains 20,000 inhabitance is noted for its coal mines
passed Hanibal 20 miles below Quincy. It is the tirmination of the Hanibal & St. Jo R. R.
The farm houses along the Mo Shore are mostly built of logs the Shore is very bluffy & light timbered. The Ill. Shore is level below Hanibal & heavy timbered
Louisiana Mo is a town of 1000 inhabitance a prety place with a number of Tabaco factories in it
Blow we were hailed here with Several Union flags we gave them a loud cheer.
this is a small place of about 3 to 500 inhab.
we arrived at a small town by the name of Westport at dark
The river here is interSperced with isleands
We passed to today the 21 Ill. Regiment going up the river
29 we arrived at alton at 4 o ' clock this morning
the Ill States prison is at this place there is a great many cescesh prisoners it takes two reg. to guard them.

at Sunrise there is about 100 Boats landing here 3 were burned down. This City looks very much like Boston the Streets are narrowr there is two double tracked horsa in town 1 - 4 rivers & the next 10 Best
